page.title: 14Armed Forces and Airspace
page.content: Great and Little Raveley and Wistow have no airfields but close by are two Royal Air Force Wyton, with Canberra and Nimrod aeroplanes and Royal Air Force Alconbury, which is used by the American Air Force as a base for Phantom A 10, and PR 1 aeroplanes. The flight path for landing and taking off at the bases overlaps the airspace of Great and Little Raveley and Wistow. The aircraft are of service type and jet powered. This causes noise pollution in an otherwise quiet rural area. Service personnel and vehicles use the roads in the area but cause no major problems. Servicemen also rent property which brings extra money to the community of the Raveleys and Wistow. The Air Force bases give a limited amount of employment to a minority of people in this lightly populated area.
